business.headline: Sensex, Nifty end higher as healthcare and financial stocks boost marketThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 341.04 points to close at 74,169.95, while the NSE Nifty50 added 111.55 points to end at 22,508.75.

Ola Electric share price tanks over 7%: Should you buy, sell or hold?Ola Electric share price: The stock dropped to a record low of Rs 46.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) in early trade. By 3:00 pm, it was trading at Rs 46.95, down 7.10%.

New pension rules: Know how divorced and separated daughters can benefitThese changes aim to encourage women's participation in governance and administration and ensure financial independence for widows and separated women.

High Court clears Gautam Adani, brother in Rs 388 crore market violation caseThe case dates back to 2012 when the Serious Fraud Investigation Office (SFIO) filed a chargesheet against Adani Enterprises Limited (AEL) and its promoters, accusing them of criminal conspiracy and cheating.

Why financial investments make a better inheritance over antiques and businessFinancial investments like savings, stocks, bonds, and mutual funds are easy to inherit through a will or nomination. They can be easily transferred through a will or nomination, giving your children financial flexibility and immediate access to funds.
Who is Shark Tank India's new judge Srikanth Bolla? All you need to knowSrikanth Bolla will now be part of Shark Tank India's panel that evaluates and invests in promising business ideas.

Explained: Why MobiKwik shares fell 15% to hit 52-week low todayMobiKwik stock price: The sharp fall in its share price came after its three-month IPO lock-in expired. As a result, 6% of the company's outstanding stock or 46 lakh shares became eligible for trading.

Rosmerta Digital files insolvency plea against Ola Electric. All you need to knowOla Electric shares slipped below Rs 50 for the first time, hitting a record low of Rs 46.94 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Reliance Jio to end free IPL cricket streaming in India after 2 yearsThe company's new subscription plan starts at Rs 299 for mobile users. Those who opt for this plan will be able to watch IPL matches on JioHotstar, the recently formed streaming platform under the Reliance-Disney joint venture.
Citigroup plans to layoff 30% of IT contractors. Here's whyThis change is intended to enhance data security, improve risk management practices, and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.

NPS pension processing now similar to OPS rules. Check latest guidelinesNew guidelines have been introduced to speed up the pension processing process and to ensure that retired employees receive their pensions on time without any trouble.
SIP and SWP are not the same. Here's how they differSIP (Systematic Investment Plan) is a way to invest money in mutual funds at regular intervals, helping investors build wealth over time.

entertainment.headline: Exclusive: Tayme on The White Lotus S3, Lisa of Blackpink, Asian representationTayme Thapthimthong's journey from a real-life security guard to a celebrated actor in The White Lotus Season 3 is truly remarkable. Paired with Blackpink's Lisa, Tayme, in an exclusive chat with India Today speaks about his journey, Asian representation and more.

Kim Kardashian vs Kanye West: Rapper fights with ex-wife over daughter's nameKanye West released a song featuring daughter North, despite Kim Kardashian's objections. She took legal action, but Kanye leaked their private chat and refused to back down, escalating their feud.
After CID, Crime Patrol begins to stream on Netflix, fans reactCrime Patrol, the iconic true-crime series on Sony TV, is now available to stream on Netflix. Fans reacted to the announcement.

Kim Soo-hyun and Kim Sae-ron controversy: Exposing Korean industry's double standardsThe controversy involving South Korean actors Kim Soo-hyun and the late Kim Sae-ron has opened a Pandora's box of issues within the entertainment industry, from age-gap relationships to the treatment of disgraced celebrities. As the public grapples with these revelations, the debate continues to rage on about ethics, consent, and gender double standards.

Kim Soo-hyun's agency acts against Indian blogger for unauthorised contentIn a dramatic turn of events, actor Kim Soo-hyun's agency has initiated legal proceedings against an Indian influencer. The influencer shared emails from the agency, revealing that he was threatened for posting 'unauthorised' content.

Hina Khan performs Umrah amid cancer battle, says she's 'overwhelmed, speechless'Actor Hina Khan performed Umrah amid her cancer battle. She shared emotional moments from Mecca on Instagram. Accompanied by her brother, the actor expressed gratitude and prayed for strength while documenting her journey.

Kim Soo-hyun's scenes cut from 'Good Day' following Kim Sae-ron controversyK-drama actor Kim Soo-hyun's scenes from MBC's variety program 'Good Day' were edited after Kim Sae-ron controversy. The production house shared a statement and confirmed the same.

TV actor Erica Fernandes says Do Patti triggered memories of abusive relationshipActor Erica Fernandes shared her experience of physical abuse in a past relationship, highlighting how films like Do Patti resurfaced painful memories. Despite the challenges, she opened up about her journey towards healing and the societal pressures that kept her silent.

Sidhu Moose Wala's little brother's Holi pic goes viral. Seen yet?A viral photo of Sidhu Moose Wala's little brother, Shubhdeep, dressed in traditional attire with Holi colours on his cheeks, has captured the hearts of fans on social media.

All Of Us Are Dead actor Lomon on India: I think of Taj Mahal and Bengal TigersSouth Korean actor Lomon, known for his role in All of Us Are Dead, discussed his latest project Family Matters and shared insights on his career and inspirations in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital.

Hina Khan shares pic of discoloured nails: Most common side effect of chemotherapyTelevision actor Hina Khan opened up about the side effects of chemotherapy on her nails, sharing a glimpse of the discolouration.

Saira Banu says she shouldn't be called AR Rahman's ex-wife: We're not divorcedSaira Banu, wife of AR Rahman, clarifies that they are separated but not divorced, addressing recent rumours. She cites her health issues as a reason and wishes Rahman well.

Priyanka Chahar Choudhary-Ankit Gupta unfollow each other, fans speculate break-upTelevision actors Priyanka Chahar Choudhary and Ankit Gupta, known for their chemistry on Udaariyaan, have unfollowed each other on Instagram, sparking rumours about their relationship status.

AR Rahman discharged from hospital, son shares health updateAR Rahman's son Ameen shared an update on the music maestro's health, explaining his hospitalisation was due to dehydration. He assured fans that Rahman is now recovering well. India Today Digital has learnt that the composer has also been discharged.

Watch: Actor Aamir Ali plays Holi with girlfriend Ankita KukretiTelevision actor Aamir Ali was seen celebrating Holi with his girlfriend Ankita Kukreti.  The couple's public appearance comes after Aamir confirmed his relationship status in a recent interview.

Ted Lasso returns: Jason Sudeikis show renewed for fourth seasonApple TV+ has renewed Ted Lasso for a fourth season with Jason Sudeikis leading the charge once more. The new season will introduce Ted coaching a women's football team.

Singer Shawn Mendes says 'dhanyawad' to India after Lollapalooza performanceSinger Shawn Mendes visited India for Lollapalooza 2025 and is currently in the nation, expressing his gratitude through social media post. He especially appreciated Mumbai.

Stand-up comic Zakir Khan treats Hasan Minhaj with delicious Indore foodZakir Khan hosted Hasan Minhaj in Indore, introducing him to the city's street food culture and hinting at a future collaboration.

Kim Soo-hyun removed as Prada's brand ambassador amid Kim Sae-ron scandal: ReportK-drama star Kim Soo-hyun has reportedly been removed as luxury brand Prada's brand ambassador following his alleged involvement in actor Kim Sae-ron's death scandal.

general news.headline: Rajnath Singh urges US spy chief to act against Khalistani group SFJ: ReportDuring his meeting with US spy chief Tulsi Gabbard, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh expressed India's concerns over the SFJ's anti-India activities on US soil and asked Washington to take action against the Khalistani outfit, ANI reported, citing sources.

Married Ranya Rao in November, separated month later, husband tells courtRanya Rao's husband Jatin Hukkeri applied for exemption from arrest in the gold smuggling case saying the couple separated a month after getting married in November.

Trump to speak to Putin as Russia demands 'ironclad' guarantees for Ukraine dealRussia is demanding 'ironclad' security guarantees in a peace treaty with Ukraine to end the three-year war, as talks advance on a US-proposed 30-day ceasefire.

Islamist terrorism, says Tulsi Gabbard on Pak-sponsored terror against IndiaTulsi Gabbard also said that US President Donald Trump and PM Modi are working together to defeat terrorism.

Minutes before Vadodara crash: CCTV footage reveals accused, friend's activitiesNew CCTV footage showed the Vadodara crash accused and his friend minutes before the crash, where he allegedly drove intoxicated, killing a woman and injuring four others on Friday.

US spy chief on China threat: Goal is peace, Trump, PM Modi's approach pragmaticTulsi Gabbard, the US Director of National Intelligence, praised PM Modi's "pragmatic approach" to China, likening it to Donald Trump's, and emphasised India's key role in regional stability.
Why your mattress matters: The science behind quality sleepWhile adults spend nearly a third of their lives sleeping, the role of mattresses in sleep quality has often been overlooked.

Inspired by crime show, Gwalior man kills wife, stages it as road accidentA Gwalior man allegedly killed his wife and staged it as a road accident. Police first treated it as an accident, but a post-mortem exposed the murder.

Trump declares pardons issued by Joe Biden void: Done by autopenPresident Donald Trump has voided Joe Biden's last-minute pardons, claiming they were signed by an autopen without Biden's approval and may involve criminal misconduct.

She hid gold wherever…: BJP MLA's vulgar remark against Ranya RaoKarnataka BJP MLA Basangouda Patil Yatnal, who made a vulgar remark against actor Ranya Rao, also said that state ministers are involved in the case and that he will expose them in the Assembly.

How did Gauri Spratt fall in love with Aamir Khan? She answersGauri Spratt lists the reasons that made her fall in love with Aamir Khan. The superstar introduced his live-in partner to the media last week ahead of his 60th birthday celebration.

Delhi man spots Zomato delivery agent eating customer's food, shares story behind itAt first, the man assumed that the Zomato delivery agent was eating food meant for a customer. It was only after speaking to the agent that he understood the story behind it.

Supreme Court fines resident Rs 1 lakh for case against road in AurovilleSupreme Court fined an Auroville resident Rs 1 lakh for obstructing development and overturned High Court and National Green Tribunal orders stalling road projects. The ruling will allow Auroville Foundation to resume its planned developmental activities in the township.

Delhi Capitals' bowling attack is the best I've been a part of in IPL: Mohit SharmaSeamer Mohit Sharma rated Delhi Capitals' bowling attack as the best he's ever been a part of in IPL history. Mohit was bought by Delhi for Rs 2.20 Crore in the mega auction.

Virat Kohli did not want to captain RCB, Rajat was best option: Jitesh SharmaRCB wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma feels that Virat Kohli did not want to captain the franchise. Jitesh feels that Rajat Patidar was RCB's best option.

Pacer Umran Malik ruled out of IPL 2025, KKR announce replacementKolkata Knight Riders' tearaway pacer Umran Malik has been ruled out of the Indian Premier League's 2025 season. KKR have replaced Umran with Chetan Sakariya.

Cricketer in trouble after opting for IPL over PSL: PCB issues legal noticeThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has issued a legal notice to Corbin Bosch for breaching his contract after he withdrew from the Pakistan Super League (PSL) to join Mumbai Indians as an IPL replacement. This is the first time the PSL window clashes with the IPL.

BCCI Sports Science head resigns, NCA expected to see major changesBCCI's newly inaugurated Centre of Excellence (COE) is set to undergo staff changes after Nitin Patel resigned as head of the Sports Science and Medical team. Additionally, several coaches, including those from NCA, may move on in the coming months.

Dehli Capitals will miss Rishabh Pant: Abishek Porel nostalgic ahead of new seasonDelhi Capitals wicketkeeper-batter Abishek Porel has said that the team will miss Rishabh Pant. In an interview with Sports Today, Porel drew similarities between the captaincies of Rishabh and Axar Patel.

MS Dhoni reveals IPL moment he regrets the most: That was a big mistakeMS Dhoni revealed the IPL moment he regrets the most ahead of the start of the 2025 campaign. Dhoni is all set to play his 18th IPL campaign and will be part of CSK once again.

Shardul Thakur to LSG? All-rounder sparks rumours after photo goes viralMumbai all-rounder Shardul Thakur's photos wearing the Lucknow Super Giants training kit have gone viral. The photos sparked rumours about whether he was going to join the injury-stricken side for the upcoming edition of the tournament.

IPL 2025: 'Mature' Karun Nair eager to grab opportunities in second DC stintIn an exclusive interaction with India Today, Karun Nair hopes he can bring in the maturity he has gained in recent times to the IPL during his second stint with the Delhi Capitals. Karun spent 2 seasons with Delhi.

Karun Nair backing on domestic form to conquer IPL 2025Vidarbha batter Karun Nair was roped in by Delhi Capitals ahead of the IPL 2025. Nair hoped to translate his domestic form into the IPL this season.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
